pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> List.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [dd9e122a71](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/21163/commits/dd9e122a714bd9656e2972ba798410bb456490b8)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ coe_algebraMap'`
`+ instance : Algebra (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) := (subalgebra _ _).toAlgebra`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K)`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (R_hat R K) (FiniteAdeleRing R K)`
`+ instance : FaithfulSMul (R_hat R K) (K_hat R K)`
`+ instance : IsScalarTower (R_hat R K) (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K)`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

:v: smmercuri can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: smmercuri can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Build failed (retrying...):
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13376268592/job/37356148651)

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13377264508/job/37359006232)
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/13377264508/job/37359006412)
Thanks, bors d+
Thanks, bors d+

Thanks!

bors d+

How about instead:
```suggestion
instance : FaithfulSMul (R_hat R K) (K_hat R K) := by
```
and below
Yes I like that! Changed to `FaithfulSMul`s

Again, I think we should use typeclasses rather than manual arguments: we can replace `h` with an `IsScalarTower` assumption. How about instead of this we place the following below `IsScalarTower.algebraMap_eq` in `Mathilb/Algebra/Algebra/IsScalarTower.lean`:
```lean
open FaithfulSMul in
theorem faithfulSMul [FaithfulSMul R A] : FaithfulSMul R S := by
  have : algebraMap S A  algebraMap R S = algebraMap R A := by simp [algebraMap_eq R S A]
  exact (faithfulSMul_iff_algebraMap_injective _ _).mpr (this  algebraMap_injective R A).of_comp
```
Admittedly this requires `S` to be a `CommSemiring` whereas `B` (corresponding to `S`) in your lemma is allowed to be non-commutative. However I claim we don't really lose any mathematical generality since the action of its center on `A` will be trivial and thus in any application we should have a commutative `B`.

Glancing at your application you might need to add:
```lean
instance : Algebra (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) := (subalgebra R K).toAlgebra
```
And in fact I think you probably won't need the `of_comp` lemma if you establish injectivity of each `algebraMap` in order, and then just compose.

Oh yes you're right, I don't need the `of_comp` lemma at all. Also don't really need 
```lean
instance : Algebra (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) := (subalgebra R K).toAlgebra
instance : FaithfulSMul (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) := ...
```
either but they might be useful to leave in anyway?
Thanks and yes, I think we should keep these instances.

Part nitpick, and part additional `IsScalarTower` instance (to make the new algebra structure useful).
```suggestion
instance : Algebra (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) := (subalgebra _ _).toAlgebra

instance : IsScalarTower (R_hat R K) (FiniteAdeleRing R K) (K_hat R K) where
  smul_assoc x y z := smul_mul_assoc x y.val z

@[simp, norm_cast]
theorem coe_algebraMap' (r : R_hat R K) :
    algebraMap (R_hat R K) (FiniteAdeleRing R K) r = algebraMap (R_hat R K) (K_hat R K) r :=
  rfl
```
Is this really needed? [Subalgebra.toAlgebra](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/Algebra/Algebra/Subalgebra/Basic.html#Subalgebra.toAlgebra) is already an instance.
I think this is needed, mainly because `FiniteAdeleRing R K` is defined as a type (rather than a `Subalgebra`), and only gets access to `Subalgebra` API via `FiniteAdeleRing.subalgebra R K`
Ah sure, you're right.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: injectivity of `algebraMap` for `FiniteIntegralAdeles` to `FiniteAdeleRing`

source.title: feat: the finite adele ring is locally compact if each of the ring of integers is compact
